attributes.action: Force MP3 Downlod Sites to Lower their Prices.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The reports of a law being introduced to cut people's internet who share and download files illegally is silly.  People may download illegally because it is too expensive otherwise.  99p for a song!  iTunes is overpriced, and Amazon, HMV and Tesco have now upped their prices.  I always buy songs legally, but am finding it harder not to download illegally, as to do the right thing, and buy songs legally is too expensive.

rejection.details: Pricing is a matter for the companies involved.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
